Carved from thick stone slabs and worn by years of footsteps, these stairs will bear centuries worth of abuse with no problem.
These stairs are laid out in a beautiful mosaic pattern that brims with personality and color.
{0.SimFirstName} can now find even more artifacts from Dig Piles by Establishing an Excavation Site. Multiple Sims are able to work on Excavation Sites at one time.
{0.SimFirstName} can now Refine crystals on the Archaeology Table. These refined crystals can be used to create powerful relics.

{0.SimFirstName} can share {M0.his}{F0.her} scholarly knowledge with other Sims by Giving an Archaeology Lecture. {M0.His}{F0.Her} ability to practice analysis on collectibles and find high quality artifacts is greatly enhanced.
{0.SimFirstName} has developed a keen eye for spotting sites of archaeological importance. {M0.He}{F0.She} can now Survey for Dig Piles in the jungle.

{0.SimFirstName}'s new Skill in Archaeology will allow {M0.him}{F0.her} to Excavate Dig Piles in Selvadorada and Uncover Artifacts on the Archaeology Table. As {M0.he}{F0.she} continues {M0.his}{F0.her} studies, {M0.he}{F0.she} will learn how to authenticate artifacts and locate more Dig Piles. {M0.He}{F0.She} will also be able to excavate artifacts without damaging them.
{0.SimFirstName} now has the knowledge and expertise to Authenticate artifacts {M0.himself}{F0.herself}. This can be done on an Archaeology Table.
{0.SimFirstName} has caught the attention of Sir Vincent Skullfinder. Look for packages in the mail from Sir Vincent and the Simsonian Institute asking for help authenticating artifacts.
{0.SimFirstName} can now Analyze genuine Artifacts, treasures, and fossils and Extract Elements from metals and crystals on the Archaeology Table.
{0.SimFirstName} can now share {M0.his}{F0.her} Archaeology expertise with other Sims by Writing an Archaeology book on the computer.
{0.SimFirstName} can now Study art and artifacts for Historical Insights to further improve {M0.his}{F0.her} Archaeology Skill.

Some Sims are driven by the search for knowledge and treasures lost to time. Spending a little bit of time in the dirt can be very rewarding.\n\nArchaeology Skill is built by digging up, authenticating, and studying ancient artifacts. Increasing this skill unlocks new interactions on the Archaeology Table.

{0.SimFirstName} has begun to understand the Selvadoradian Culture. {M0.He}{F0.She} will be able to ask about local sights and find out more about the local heritage. The local foods will be a strong culinary adventure.
{0.SimFirstName} has picked up new moves to try on the dance floor. {F0.She}{M0.He} has also earned enough trust to inquire about local myths.

{0.SimFirstName} can now pass as a local and can write travel guides on the computer. {F0.She}{M0.He} can order off of the secret menu at food stalls and market tables. {F0.She}{M0.He} has even learned the local secrets to avoiding fire flies and lightning bugs in the jungle.
{0.SimFirstName} has started to perfect that local salutation and has developed a taste for the local food. {0.SimFirstName} has unlocked new latin guitar songs.

{0.SimFirstName} is becoming more acquainted with the local Selvadorada culture. {F0.She}{M0.He} can try the local salutation or Selvadoradian Introduction. {F0.She}{M0.He} will be able to share pictures of {F0.her}{M0.his} vacation here.

Sims who are passionate about the Selvadoradian culture immerse themselves in it. They are less likely to make awkward comments and are more likely to nail those tricky dance moves.\n\nSelvadoradian Culture Skill is built by socializing with the locals in Selvadorada, tasting the local cuisine, and interacting with local vendors.

These Sims are lovers of all things ancient. They will be especially confident at museums, and even more flirty while on dates there. They also have the unique ability to donate artifacts to the Simsonian Musuem.
Treasure Hunters have a sharp eye and will occasionally find treasure and relics in Treasure Chests that other Sims miss.

Selvadorada is divided into two regions.

The Plaza district contains rentable lots, the Cantina, the Puerto Llamante Marketplace, and the Alam Museum of Archaeology. Here you can mingle with Selvadoradians in a safe village environment.

The Belomisia Jungle district is where adventurers go in search of Omisca Ruins and ancient artifacts. The natural dangers of the jungle are very real. Make sure to be bring supplies to combat these dangers.

In the Puerto Llamante Marketplace you can find locals selling the best Adventure Gear to combat the Natural Dangers of the Belomisia Jungle. Stock up on items like the jungle machete to progress through path obstacles. Keep supplies like the grilled cheese ready to eat in your inventory so you can make those long expeditions. Never forget to bring along as many bug sprays as you can. They automatically ward off natural dangers you will encounter.

It's time to take a vacation to beautiful Selvadorada. Pull out your phone, click on 'Take a Vacation...', choose who to take with you, and select the world of Selvadorada.\n\nSelect your favorite Villa or Bungalow to rent out and stay at while on vacation.

Skilled Sims will have an easier go of a trek into the jungle.\n\nA high Selvadoradian Culture skill won't just help you navigate the local social scene. At higher levels it will also help you avoid Fire Fly and Lightning Bug natural dangers. Logic and Fitness skills will help when encountering traps. Gardening skill will help with getting through the vines blocking path obstacles.

Sims can stick their heads in a skill book or they can head out into the field to learn Archaeology.\n\nIn the Belomisia Jungle, Excavate Dig Piles or Excavation Sites to increase skill. The archaeology work bench can be used to Uncover and Authenticate found artifacts. Sims with a high level skill may also receive requests from the Archeology Institute to authenticate artifacts. Sims need to remember to return those objects to collect a service fee.

Dig piles and Excavation Sites will have a number of different items to be found. Expect to find clumps of dirt, Unauthenticated artifacts, fossils, bone dust and more.

Clumps of Dirt may look unexciting, but with the help of a archaeology work bench a Sim can find the artifact within.

If you find bone dust make sure to keep it. Bone dust can be traded to Selvadoradians for powerful poison antidotes.

One of the perks of the Archaeology Skill is the ability of upgrading dig piles to excavation sites. Excavation sites allow up to four Sims to dig at once. These sites also allow archaeologists to dig up more artifacts than a standard dig pile.\n\nWith a Level 6 or higher archaeologist, click on a dig pile and choose 'Establish Excavation Site'.

Sims who love history and love digging in the dirt find a fortunate confluence of these passions in Archaeology. This skill will reward you with knowledge, and fabulous artifacts to decorate the house.

Every Archaeologist needs a dependable Archaeology Work Bench to work on. This handy work bench allows a Sim Uncover Artifacts from clumps of dirt. They then can Authenticate those artifacts to determine their rarity.\n\nWhen an artifact is fully authenticated the Sim can still Analyze the collectible for fun and archaeology skill!

Sims may encounter Path Obstacles blocked with large stone doors. There is no way to get through these paths during the current vacation. These paths may be open during the next vacation to Selvadorada. Visit again for new paths to explore.

Path Obstacles will block progression into the jungle. When a Sim finds one of these large gates overgrown with vines they can use their hands to clear it. A better prepared adventurer will use any Jungle Machete they have in their inventory and avoid the sore hands. Sims with high gardening skill will have a easier time clearing these Path Obstacles.

Fire Flies, Spiders, Plasma Bats, Lighting Bugs, and Bees are all possible Natural Dangers sims will encounter in the jungle.

A smart explorer will always have adventure gear in their inventory to ward off these troubles. The less prepared explorer will have to suffer all the burns, poisons and shocks that the Jungle throws at them.

High Selvadoradian Culture, Fitness, and Logic skill will help Sims avoid some of these Natural Dangers.

There are hidden areas in the Belomisia Jungle. Reveal these areas by traveling through Path Obstacles. Sims will be rewarded for their curiosity. These areas contain dig piles, collectibles, and environmental buffs.
Mystical Relics are powerful objects created by combining top and bottom pieces with a refined crystal. They can be used to cast powerful curses or blessings on Sims.
Top and bottom pieces of these relics are found in Omiscan Temple treasure chests and excavation sites in the Belomisia Jungle.

Each Sim will have to learn through trial and error what a Mystical Relic will cast. Once a Sim has cast a mystical relic on themselves or another Sim they will learn the curse or blessing cast by that mystical relic combination. This information will be displayed in the mystical relic tooltips and in the tooltips on the pieces during the combination process.

To create a Mystical Relic a Sim needs to have all the pieces in their inventory. A top and bottom relic piece and a refined crystal are needed. First, Click on a top or bottom Mystical Relic piece and choose 'Fuse With…'. Select an appropriate piece to combine. Once completed, Click on the combined Mystical Relic piece and choose "Insert Crystal". Select the refined crystal and complete the process.

Each Mystical Relic is powered by a refined crystal. A Sim with Archaeology Skill can use a Archaeology Table to Refine a crystal. Crystals are either common, uncommon, or rare . These rarities influence which curse or blessing a Mystical Relic can cast.

All curses can be dispelled through hard work. Check the information on the buff for clues on how to solve the curse. A successful solve will result in a blessing being bestowed on the Sim.\n\nSims can also dispel curses by donating to the Statue of Madre Cosecha. This will not result in a blessing.

Each time a curse or blessing is cast there is a chance that a Mystical Relic can be damaged. Cracks will appear if this happens. If the Mystical Relic is damaged again it will be destroyed.\n\nKeep all mystical relic pieces you find so you can replace old Mystical Relics that have been destroyed from use.

Mystical Relics need time to recharge after casting a curse or blessing. If a Sim has casted a curse recently they will have to wait a few hours for the Mystical Relic to recharge.\n\nWhen a Sim is affected by curse or a blessing on them they cannot receive another curse or blessing.

Sims who trek deep enough into the Jungle may find the Omiscan Temple.\n\nThis ancient temple has unexplainable properties which will confuse and boggle the unprepared. The layout of this temple will change with each visit to Selvadorada. Walls will rearrange, traps will change, and treasure chests will shuffle. If the temple is getting the best of your Sim, try returning on another vacation.

In order to get through the Omiscan Temple, the Sim must first solve the Temple's defenses. The Sim must find and activate the correct triggers in order for the gate to unlock and reveal the next room. Sims can examine each trap which will reveal if a trigger is valid or not. However, the Sim's success at validating a trigger depends on their skill level and the Temple defense they are examining. Hover over the Examine interaction to see which skill is associated with the defense.
The Omiscan Temple will always have a rare Treasure Chest at the end with an assortment of great rewards. Open these chests to find pieces of Mystical Relics or Omiscan Treasures.

Not everyone in Selvadorada is a local. Don't get confused by the other tourists. Seek out Sims wearing the local fashion or working the local shops.\n\nLocals will have unique socials. During emergencies Sims can trade Bone Dust for Poison Antidotes with locals.

A Sim with a high Selvadoradian Culture Skill can dance the Rumbasim. This is the hottest dance craze in Selvadorada.\n\nA high skilled Sim also has access to the secret menu with vendors in the Puerto Llamante Marketplace. Click on a vendor and choose 'Purchase Secret Items'. A high skill also allows Sims to ward off lightning bugs and firefly natural dangers without the need of adventure gear. But really, it's all about the Rumbasim.

When in Selvadorada, do as the Selvadoradians do. Sims can gain the Selvadoradian Culture skill while interacting with the locals. A Sim with this skill will be able to learn local survival tips, appreciate the flavor of the local food, learn new guitar songs and even pick up a few dance moves.

Raising this skill is as simple as interacting with the Selvadoradians, trying their foods, and shopping in the open air market. Locals have a lot of knowledge. Try asking them about local sights, the Omiscan Ruins, or about the jungle. Soon you will be able to use the Selvadoradian greetings or retell the local folk tales.
A rental lot for your vacation Sims.
This is a temple. It is not a tomb, a ruin, a dungeon, or a catacomb. It is a temple.

The jungle is teeming with wondrous sights and hidden dangers. Brave adventurers can explore the ruins of the ancient Omiscans. Skilled Sims and those equipped with gear from the Marketplace will do well here.

Determined explorers who forge a path through thick jungle can uncover secluded spots where rare treasures can be found. Local legends describe a temple that mystically rearranges itself hidden deep in the Omiscan ruins.
Come enjoy the sights and sounds of Selvadorada! Pack some gear before heading out to the jungle, or relax and experience different food and culture. Swing by the Marketplace, right by the Cantina.
